title: What are the physical effects of sexual abuse on a child?
content:
A child can face a number of physical effects in result of sexual abuse including:

 - Sexually transmitted diseases

 - Pregnancy and unsafe abortions

 - Complaints of pain or itching

 - Difficulty in walking or sitting

 - Repeated unusual injuries

 - Pain when urinating and or defecating

 - Frequent infections

 - Diseases affecting liver, heart, or lungs

 - Developed proclivity for substance abuse and depression
